sources.title: The Professionals (1966) Burt Lancaster · Lee Marvin
sources.description: Former allies of Mexican revolutionaries are recruited by a wealthy Texan to rescue his wife, who has allegedly been kidnapped (1917).    A Western of dubious morality, but highly entertaining.

sources.title: The Professionals (1966)
sources.description: The Professionals is a Western film directed by Richard Brooks, set in the early 20th century. The story follows a group of four men: a wealthy rancher, a cunning mercenary, a rugged sharpshooter, and a skilled explosives expert. The film revolves around the abduction of a beautiful Mexican woman named Maria, who is taken by a revolutionary bandit named Jesus Raza. Her husband, the rich rancher, hires the four specialists to rescue her.The team embarks on a perilous journey into the harsh Mexican landscape, facing various dangers along the way, including hostile bandits and treacherous terrain.Upon reaching Raza’s hideout, the team confronts him but discovers that the situation is more complicated than it seemed. Tensions rise as they negotiate and attempt to rescue Maria while dealing with their own moral dilemmas.The film explores themes such as honor, loyalty, and personal sacrifice, culminating in an intense climax that tests the characters' resolve and ethics as they seek redemption and justice.

metadata.Plot: A rich Texan, J.W. Grant, selects three men and invites them to his private train to offer them a contract: Rescue his wife who has been kidnapped by a Mexican revolutionary. The leader of the men, Rico, decides they would be a better team if Grant would hire one more man, an explosives expert. Grant quickly agrees and soon the four are off to complete the contract. However, while on the trail, they discover some interesting facts, like has Mrs. Grant 'really' been kidnapped?
metadata.Actors: Burt Lancaster, Lee Marvin, Robert Ryan
metadata.Awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. 3 wins & 9 nominations total
